alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 28 at 5:47AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of East Central Maine, including the following county, Penobscot. * WHEN...Until noon EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways and low land flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 547 AM EST, Emergency management reported an ice jam causing flooding near Merrill Brook Lane and Garden Lane cutting off access to residents. Minor flooding is already occurring. Water behind the ice jam will continue to rise as temperatures fall resulting in little to no ice movement. - Residents near Merrill Brook that are located on Merrill Brook Lane and Garden Lane are the most likely to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Howland.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
